summary: Empathy is when you understand and share someone else's feelings. It's like putting yourself in their shoes. You might show empathy by hugging a friend who is sad. Scientists are still learning about empathy, including how it develops and if it can be measured. It's an important topic in many areas, like ethics, medicine, and even politics, because it affects how we treat each other. There are different types of empathy, like emotional and cognitive, which help us connect with others in various ways.
title: Empathy
